Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohhhh! She's absolutely adorable!

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: He.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...Oh, sorry. He's-he's dressed all in pink.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: That's his favorite color.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...Oh. That's... fun for him.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohhh, wow. Look at that. How cute.

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Thank youuu.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ohh. May I?

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Uh, sure!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [climbs under desk] Hey, look at me, I'm a baby! I'm one of those babies from "Look Who's Talking." What am I thinking? [Laughs] Look at all those staplers! What's a stapler!? I don't even know, I'm a baby! Hey, Mom, I'm thirsty! I'm thirsty, Mama! I want some milk. And you know where milk comes from! Breasts.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: ...Almost done?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just about... yup. Now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. I have started to see Karen. It's very new, and... not really ready to talk about it openly yet, just because, I think, once the word gets out there, it might affect the way people behave around us or... I dunno. Just, not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jan, it um... looks like a check, piece of paper of some sort. Receipt. I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Jan, this is Angela Martin from accounting.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [over phone] Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Look, we have a rebate from... the Federal Work Opportunity Program and no one knows what that means.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: We get that money for hiring an ex-convict.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't hire an ex-convict. Unless they mean Toby. Convicted rapist. [Jan sighs] ... I'm just kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: When did the check come?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Last week.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay, that's when the branches merged, so Josh must have been taking advantage of this program. Smart move.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: One of the Stamford people is a criminal?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Jan, speaking of Stamford, Hannah brought in her baby.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Jan, which one of the new employees is a criminal?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, reformed convict, and, uh, I'm not sure. Though hang on, let me email our HR, stay on the line.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hannah?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hmm. Martin?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kuhhhh... you are such a racist.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, why am I a racist?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because you think he's black.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He is black... right? And...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it. Stop it right-stop it right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...Okay it's someone named Martin Nash.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why did the convict have to be a black guy? It is such a stereotype. I just wish that Josh had made a more progressive choice. Like a white guy... who went to prison for... polluting a black guy's lake.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I wonder what he did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In our society, a black man can be arrested for almost anything. He was probably at a sporting event and... saw some people pushing each other, and he intervened.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why would anyone go to jail for that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sssssso, what we need to do... is to forget about this whole Martin in prison thing. People will draw unfair conclusions about Martin and or black people.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay. Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sure. Let's protect the convicts. At the expense of the general feeling of safety in the workplace. As a 90-pound female that sits in an ill-lit, rarely-visited corner of the office, naturally I agree with that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. All right. [everyone leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [picks up phone] Jim Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [over phone] I am so horny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...Okay I can't... help you... with that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I think you can, Big Tuna. Tell me about that Indian chick, Kelly. She seems pretty slutty. Good for a romp in the sack.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She is dating Ryan, I think.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, and I care why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She's... high-maintenance.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Next. How about... [motions toward Angela]. Blondes are more fun. C'mon, trust me on that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, trust me, that would be fun for no one.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay fine. Um. Pam, the receptionist. Paaam. Should I go for it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...Absolutely you should.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Jackpot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just... try to be cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, are you cool, really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm cool, I'm cool, I'm so cool. Tell me what is going on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... Martin, from Stamford, was, at one time, in prison. [Dwight starts to run] No. Dwight! Be cool! Be cool!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am greatly concerned about having a convict in the office. And I do not care if that convict is white, black, Asian, German, or some kind of halfsy. I do not like criminals.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All... righty, let's get started. What is she into?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know Pam pretty well. I know the things that she likes, and, just as important, I know the things that she hates. So, one of the things that she likes is pranks. And, the things that she hates...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Frisbee-based competitions...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: She...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I started the main Frisbee golf club at Cornell. Where I went to college. I live to frolf.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Lead off with that. She loves hunting. She also loves those ads for Six Flags, with the old guy. [Andy hums Six Flag ad] Got it. Also... do you speak pig latin?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Martin, how's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Good. Getting settled, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah. Good good. Good. Just a second. Everybody? May I have your attention please? I realize that a lot of you have already heard that Martin here has had some trouble with the law, but I just want to declare publicly that I... trust... him, completely, and that anybody who doesn't is an ignorant, dumb... person. Okay? As a matter of fact, you show me a white man you trust and I will show you a black man that I trust even more. Pam. Tell me a white person you trust.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: My dad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Danny Glover. [Jim raises hand] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Jonas Salk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Justin Timberlake?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Please. Colin Powell.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey I got one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Jesus.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Apollo Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Close your eyes. Picture a convict. What's he wearing? Nothing special, baseball cap on backwards, baggy pants... he says something ordinary like... 'yo, thats shizzle.' Okay. Now slowly open your eyes again. Who are you picturing? A black man? Wrong. That was a white woman. Surprised? Well, shame on you.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: So... you all wanna know what I was in for?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. That's not cool. You don't have to tell them.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Um, I really don't mind. It was a stupid mistake. I was working in finance and, I... got involved in some insider trading. So, I spent a little time in the clink.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] That is awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I had Martin explain to me three times what he got arrested for, because... it sounds an awful lot like what I do here every day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What was prison like?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Not terrible. Boring. We do the same thing every day. But... at least we got outdoors time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You got outdoors time?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Two hours, every day. Sometimes we'd play pickup football games...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, why don't we get outdoors time?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, some days I never go outside.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we are running a business, so.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What was your cell like?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Not good. Uh... a little bit bigger than Michael's office... but, you know, I really only slept there. You know, during the day, there-our time's our own. They had uh, classes, I took some... watercolor classes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They have art classes?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Yeap. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: They have business classes there?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: They did, taught by some uh, Harvard business school guys-a lot of the guys also, that were in the class, the inmates, a lot of them have gone on to do extraordinary things in business.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kinda sounds like... prison's... better than Dunder-Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah. Well. That's not true.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I would so rather be in prison.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Prison sounds great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No you would not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This place is not prison. It's... way better than prison.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [singsong voice] Baby. Hello baby. Here you want to play with this?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You can't give paperclips to a baby. He could swallow.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh, it's okay. I've got tons of them. You like that? Goo-goo-goo-goo?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Pam-a-lama-ding-dong. Listen, you're cute. There is no gettin' around it. So... I don't know if you like country music, but I was thinking maybe one of these days we could drive out to a field, crank up some tunes, smoke a few Macanudos... maybe even toss a disk around. Utway ooday ooyay inkthay, Ampay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow... I-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shh. Think about it. I'll hit you back.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow. That was... wow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! Listen up everybody! Um, you guys said that prison was better than this place, and I heard ya, loud and clear, so, I am instituting some changes to make this more like prison. We are going to start with an hour of outdoor time. So let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, it's freezing out.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I can't feel my toes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why don't we... pump some iron? Anyone wanna... pump up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What is that, like... five pounds?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's uh... two and a half. I'm not going for bulk, I'm going for tone.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm going back inside.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's... freaking cold out here. Anybody wants to stay out, you've got about... twenty-seven minutes of rec time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh heyyy. Martiiin. You have TV in the joint?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Yeah, in the rec room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah. A ten inch black and white?

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Actually, our TV was bigger than that one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These people don't realize how lucky they are. This office is the American Dream. And they would rather be in the hole.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Andy. I thought of one last tact you can take with Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Quick question - do you play the guitar?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I play the banjo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hold on, let me think about that, yes, that'll work. But can you sing in a sexy high falsetto voice?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] You know I can, my man.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup. That's perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm gonna go get my banjo out of my car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...I'm messing with Andy. I'm sending him to all the women in the office with... just... terrible information on how to get them to go out with him.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I love it. I want in. Who's the target?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...Oh, you know what? ... It was... gonna be Pam, but...

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Perfect. What do I do? Just give me an assignment.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, you know what though? I feel like I already sicked him on Pam... we'll give her a break. Let's think of someone else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right everybody, there has been a lot of name calling against our office today. Corporate maligning, slurring, much of it coming from one of you, who claims that prison is better... than... here. And none of can say "Boo" because none of us have ever been to prison. Well, there's somebody I'd like you to meet. Somebody else who has been to prison, who can tell you what it is really like [puts on bandanna]. I'm prison Mike! You know why they call me prison Mike?!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do you really expect us to believe you're somebody else?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you really expect me to not push you up against the wall, beeyotch?! [employees protest] All right, hey, hey, hey, hey, that's just the way we talk in the clink. Been a lot of fun talk about prison today, but I am here to scare you straight. I AM HERE TO SCARE YOU STRAIIIGHT!! In prison you are somebody's bitch. Oh, and you. [points to Ryan] You, my friend, would be da belle of da ball. Don't drop the soap! Don't drop the soap!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, please. [Michael makes kissing noises]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Where... did you learn all of this?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Internet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, not prison.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And prison. Eh, fifty-fifty, both. Look, prison stinks, is what I'm saying. It's not like you can go home, and, recharge your batteries, and come back in the morning and, be with your friends, having fun in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What'd you do, Prison Mike?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I stole. ... And I robbed. And I kidnapped... the... president's son. And held him for ransom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is... quite the rap sheet, Prison Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I nevah got caught, neither.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you're... in... prison, but, mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Prison Mike? What was the food like in prison?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gruel. Sandwiches. Gruel omelettes. Nothing but gruel. Plus, you can eat your own hair.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow. Prison sounds horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah. Well, thank you, Andy. Tanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Prison Mike. What's the very very worst thing about prison?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't encourage him, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The worst thing about prison was the... was the Dementors. They... were flying all over the place, and they were scary. And they'd come down, and they'd suck the soul out of your body, and it hurt!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Demen-Dementors like in Harry Potter?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, not Harry Potter. ... There are no movies in prison. This is my point! You guys got it soft, and cushy! This place is freaking awesome! The people are awesome! Your boss is nice! Everyone seems to get along! People are tolerant! People who... have jumped to conclusions can redeem themselves! Nobody is nobody's bitch. I hope that this scared you. And from me, Prison Mike, to you, I just wanna thank you for listening to me. Letting me be a part of your life today. 'Cause you got a good life! YOu got a good life. A good life. [turns around, takes bandanna off] So. What do you think? It doesn't sound so great, does it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow. Thank you. Um, that must have been hard for you to relive that. Both of you.

Quote.Speaker: Martin
Quote.Text: Yeah, that... wasn't really... at all my experience. There were certain elements of what you performed, I've seen on television. But it didn't remind me of my time in prison.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay, fine. You guys think prison is so great? All right. Well, here you go. [locks employees in conference room]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael. Come on. Let us out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! If you think is prison is so wonderful, then, enjoy prison! They are such babies. I am going to leave them in there until they can appreciate what it's like to have freedom. And if this doesn't bother them, then I am out of ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [knocking on door] Hey! Let us out of here! Hey! I have-

Quote.Speaker: Hannah
Quote.Text: Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [answering phone] This is Toby. Hey Pam. Where are you calling from?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael. Why's everyone locked in the conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They were very disrespectful to me, and to the office. And Martin has had a bad influence, to think that I gave him the benefit of the doubt.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, you're going to have to let 'em out. Or... or I will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what Toby? I am teaching them a lesson, so.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You know they're teasing you. I mean... obviously, this is... a much nicer place than an actual prison. We get paid to be here. We go home afterwards and have social lives. We have... we have parties here. They're teasing you. To be funny.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [unlocks door] Okay nutcases, get out of there! Good work. Long day. Really long. Why don't you guys head home. Early. Time off for good behavior! Heh. Good job. Enjoy your freedoms!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Martin went from being a new guy from Stamford... to a convict, to... my friend. Back to a convict. Then to... a kind of a nuisance, actually, to be completely honest. And finally, to... a quitter. And I will not miss him. And that is not because he is black.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] So we've been told, and some choose to believe it, I know they're wrong, wait and see, 'cause one day we'll find it, the ainbowray onnectionkay, the lovers, the dreamers, and meeee...
